trial_identification.studytitle: Comparison between intraarticular dexmedetomidine and morphine for postoperative analgesia after arthroscopic meniscal surgery
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Comparison between intraarticular dexmedetomidine and morphine for postoperative analgesia after arthroscopic meniscal surgery

interventions.interventions: Arm 1: Intra-articular dexmedetomidine 1 mcg/kg (in 20 ml saline) before wound closure once Arm 2: Intra-articular morphine 30 mcg/kg (in 20 ml saline) before wound closure once
interventions.comparator: Arm 3: Intra-articular saline 20 ml before wound closure once

primaryOutcome.outcome: Visual analogue scale (VAS) score (0-10) at rest
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Before induction of anesthesia, on arrival to recovery room, and at 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 18, 24, 30, 36, 42, and 48 hours after surgery

primaryOutcome.outcome: Visual analogue scale (VAS) score (0-10) on movement
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Before induction of anesthesia, on arrival to recovery room, and at 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 18, 24, 30, 36, 42, and 48 hours after surgery

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Observers Assessment of Alertness and Sedation (OAA/S) score
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Before induction of anesthesia, on arrival to recovery room, and at 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 18, 24, 30, 36, 42, and 48 hours after surgery

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Time to first analgesia request postoperatively (minutes)
Total amount of tramadol administered postoperatively

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: - American Society of Anesthesiologists physical class I or II - Arthroscopic meniscal surgery under general anaesthesia - Elective surgery
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: - Regional anaesthesia - History of opioids or sedative agents use on regular basis for more than a week prior to surgery - renal impairment (serum creatinine > 200 mcg/ml)

trial_design.concealment: Patients are screened for eligibility by a reaserach assistant. After informed consent is obtained, study medication is prepared in pharmacy. Study group allocation is done using sealed serially numbered opaque envelopes based on the randomization schedule.
trial_design.sequence: Randomization is performed using a computer-generated randomization schedule

fundingsource.fundingname: Department of Anesthesia and Critical Care, King Abdulaziz University

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This randomized double-blind study was designed to determine the analgesic effects of intra-articular dexmedetomidine and to compare it with those of morphine in patients undergoing arthroscopic knee surgery.
